content:
I created a new Lean project Foo following the instructions here:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/install/project.html
In the project, I have a subdirectory Foo which contains two files: Foo/Source.lean and Foo/Test.lean and a file Foo.lean whose contents are:

import Foo.Source
import Foo.Test

In the file Foo/Source.lean I defined an identifier foo:

def foo (x : â„•) := x + 1

Then in Foo/Test.lean, I import Foo and check to see if I can refer to foo:

import Foo.Source
#check foo

Lean tells me that foo is an unknown identifier. What went wrong?

Oh, never mind. After exiting and restarting the VScode session, the problem went away.
On the other hand, the problem was not fixed by the "Lean 4: Server: Restart Server" action inside VScode.
Ching-Tsun Chou has marked this topic as resolved.

I believe after modifying files, you need to rebuild the project and only then are the imports available.
